intro: Psychotria pendula subsp. grenadensis, commonly known as the Grenada psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Grenada. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its pendulous racemes of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and rocky areas.
